context.introduction: Discover the basics of Italian sauces and herbs. Learn how simple combinations and fresh herbs create classic flavors.

sections.title: Simple Sauces
sections.content: The simplest Italian sauces use just a few ingredients, like tomato, garlic, and olive oil.

sections.title: Herb Timing
sections.content: Add fresh herbs at the end of cooking for bright flavor; dried herbs can be added earlier.

sections.title: Classic Pairings
sections.content: Certain herbs pair naturally with specific ingredients, like basil with tomato and sage with butter.

sections.title: Kitchen Wisdom
listItems: Fresh herbs behave differently than dried ones
Some flavors develop better with heat, others without
